Note: Date of issue based on the dates of the Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Text says that the biggest society in the world is that of the "U.S. coupon cutters," the twenty million folks who have lent their money to the country to win the war. And there is not much time left to belong to this organization of patriots. Illustration shows a pair hands holding a Liberty bond. Design for a newspaper advertisement for the Liberty Loan.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: Be a "coupon cutter"
